meanings.definition: To bid more than the value or worth of something in an auction.
meanings.sent1: She kept overbidding on the antique vase, not realizing its true value.
meanings.sent2: During the auction, he decided to overbid on the painting he really wanted.
meanings.sent3: The overbidding war between the two collectors made the auctioneer chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to overbid on items was like throwing money into a bottomless pit.
meanings.sent5: The sound of her overbidding echoed through the silent auction hall.

meanings.definition: To make an excessively high bid in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: In the excitement of the moment, he ended up overbidding for the rare stamp.
meanings.sent2: She regretted overbidding on the necklace when she saw its actual price.
meanings.sent3: The overbidding frenzy at the auction caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent4: His habit of overbidding always put him at a disadvantage in auctions.
meanings.sent5: The overbidding competition was fierce, with each participant trying to outdo the other.

meanings.definition: To exceed the appropriate or reasonable limit in bidding.
meanings.sent1: Knowing when to stop overbidding is crucial to avoid overspending.
meanings.sent2: The temptation to overbid can sometimes lead to financial regrets.
meanings.sent3: His tendency to overbid on online auctions became a running joke among his friends.
meanings.sent4: Overbidding beyond your budget can result in financial difficulties later on.
meanings.sent5: The thrill of overbidding often clouds judgment and leads to impulsive decisions.
